[docs]
 16    def __init__(
 17            self,
 18            ser: serial.Serial = None,
 19            com_port: str = None, baud_rate: int = 115200,
 20            robot: Mirobot_UART = None,
 21            min_x: float = 200,
 22            min_y: float = -50,
 23            max_x: float = 300,
 24            max_y: float = 50,
 25            z: float = None
 26    ):
 27        """
 28        Initializing drawing helper. Will use serial in following order: ser, com_port and baud_rate, robot
 29
 30        Args:
 31            ser (:obj:`serial.Serial`, optional): Existing serial
 32            com_port (:obj:`str`, optional): Serial port (default: None)
 33            baud_rate (:obj:`int`, optional): Baud rate (default: 115200)
 34            robot (:obj:`Mirobot_UART`, optional): Existing Wlkata robot instance (default: None)
 35            min_x (:obj:`float`, optional): Minimum x coordinate (default: None)
 36            min_y (:obj:`float`, optional): Minimum y coordinate (default: None)
 37            max_x (:obj:`float`, optional): Maximum x coordinate (default: None)
 38            max_y (:obj:`float`, optional): Maximum y coordinate (default: None)
 39            z (:obj:`float`, optional): Z coordinate (default: None)
 40
 41        Examples:
 42            >>> serial1 = serial.Serial(port='/dev/tty.usbserial-1120', baudrate=115200)
 43            >>> drawer1 = Drawing(serial1)
 44
 45            >>> drawer2 = Drawing(com_port='/dev/tty.usbserial-1120')
 46
 47            >>> serial1 = serial.Serial(port='COM3', baudrate=115200)
 48            >>> MT4_1 = wlkatapython.MT4_UART(serial1)
 49            >>> MT4_1.init(serial1, -1)
 50            >>> drawer3 = Drawing(robot=MT4_1)
 51
 52        Raises:
 53            :class:`Exception`: If serial port or baud_rate is not valid
 54        """
 55        self.ser = None
 56        self.com_port = None
 57        self.baud_rate = None
 58        self.robot = None
 59
 60        if ser is not None:
 61            assert not ser.is_open, 'Serial is not open'
 62            self.ser = ser
 63            self.com_port = ser.port
 64            self.baud_rate = ser.baudrate
 65            self.robot = Mirobot_UART()
 66            self.robot.init(ser, -1)
 67        elif com_port is not None and baud_rate is not None:
 68            self.ser = serial.Serial(com_port, baud_rate)
 69            self.com_port = com_port
 70            self.baud_rate = baud_rate
 71            self.robot = Mirobot_UART()
 72            self.robot.init(ser, -1)
 73        elif robot is not None:
 74            self.ser = robot.pSerial
 75            self.com_port = robot.pSerial.port
 76            self.baud_rate = robot.pSerial.baudrate
 77            self.robot = robot
 78        if self.ser is None:
 79            warnings.warn("No serial port passed")
 80            devices = Drawing.detect_ports()
 81            if devices is None:
 82                raise Exception("No serial ports detected")
 83            for i in range(len(devices)):
 84                print(f'{i}: {devices[i]}')
 85            selection = input("Which ports would you like to use: ")
 86            try:
 87                self.ser = serial.Serial(devices[int(selection)], baud_rate)
 88                self.com_port = devices[int(selection)]
 89                self.baud_rate = baud_rate
 90                self.robot = Mirobot_UART()
 91                self.robot.init(ser, -1)
 92                self.robot.pSerial = self.ser
 93            except:
 94                # TODO: Error types
 95                pass
 96                # raise Exception("Unable to open serial port")
 97
 98        self.line_segments_groups = None
 99        self.points_groups = None
100        self.min_x = min_x
101        self.min_y = min_y
102        self.max_x = max_x
103        self.max_y = max_y
104        self.z = z


105
106    def __del__(self):
107        if self.ser:
108            self.ser.close()
109


[docs]
110    @classmethod
111    def detect_ports(
112            cls
113    ) -> list[str]:
114        """
115        Get available serial ports
116
117        Returns:
118            A list of available serial ports
119        """
120        os_name = platform.system()
121        devices = None
122        if os_name == 'Darwin':
123            try:
124                command = "ls /dev/tty.*"
125                result = subprocess.run(command, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, shell=True, text=True)
126                if result.returncode == 0:
127                    devices = result.stdout.split('\n')[:-1]
128            except Exception as e:
129                print(f"An error occurred: {e}")
130        elif os_name == 'Windows':
131            # TODO: Check if is correct
132            try:
133                # Command to list COM ports
134                command = "wmic path Win32_SerialPort get DeviceID,Caption"
135                result = subprocess.run(command, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, shell=True, text=True)
136
137                if result.returncode == 0:
138                    devices = result.stdout.strip().split('\n')[1:]  # Skip the header row
139                    devices = [line.strip() for line in devices if line.strip()]  # Remove empty lines
140                else:
141                    print(f"Error finding COM ports: {result.stderr.strip()}")
142            except Exception as e:
143                print(f"An error occurred: {e}")
144        else:
145            pass
146
147        return devices


148


[docs]
149    def edges_from_image(
150            self,
151            image_path: str,
152            smoothness: float = 0.0001,
153            binary_threshold: int = 127,
154            method: int = cv2.RETR_TREE,
155            blur: bool = True,
156            edge_detection_threshold1: int = 100,
157            edge_detection_threshold2: int = 200
158    ) -> list[list[list[tuple[Any, Any]]]]:
159
160        """
161        Extract edges from image and approximate them with line segments based on smoothness.
162
163        Args:
164            image_path (:obj:`str`): Input image path.
165            smoothness (:obj:`float`, optional): Smoothness parameter. Higher values simplify edges. (default: 0.0001)
166            binary_threshold (:obj:`int`, optional): Binary threshold for edge detection. (default: 127)
167            method (:obj:`int`, optional): Contour retrieval method. Options:
168                    cv2.RETR_TREE (default): Retrieve both inner and outer edges.
169                    cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL: Retrieve only the outer edges.
170            blur (:obj:`bool`, optional): Whether to apply Gaussian blur before edge detection. (default: True)
171            edge_detection_threshold1 (:obj:`int`, optional): Lower threshold for Canny edge detection. (default: 100)
172            edge_detection_threshold2 (:obj:`int`, optional): Upper threshold for Canny edge detection. (default: 200)
173
174        Examples:
175            Basic usage with a sample image:
176
177            >>> drawer = Drawing(com_port="/dev/tty.usbserial-1120")
178            >>> drawer.edges_from_image("image.jpg")
179
180            Specifying all parameters:
181
182            >>> drawer.edges_from_image("image.jpg", smoothness=0.01, binary_threshold=127, method=cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL, blur=False, edge_detection_threshold1=50, edge_detection_threshold2=150)
183
184        Returns:
185            List of line segment groups, where each group corresponds to edges in a contour
186        """
187
188        # Load the grayscale image
189        image = cv2.imread(image_path, cv2.IMREAD_GRAYSCALE)
190
191        if image is None:
192            raise ValueError(f"Failed to load image from path: {image_path}")
193
194        if blur:
195            # Apply Gaussian blur
196            image = cv2.GaussianBlur(image, (5, 5), 0)
197
198        # Apply binary threshold to the blurred image
199        _, binary = cv2.threshold(image, binary_threshold, 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY_INV)
200
201        # Detect edges on the blurred binary image
202        edges_blurred = cv2.Canny(binary, edge_detection_threshold1, edge_detection_threshold2)
203
204        # Find contours from the edges of the blurred image
205        contours_blurred, hierarchy = cv2.findContours(edges_blurred, method, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)
206
207        # Approximate contours with line segments and organize by groups
208        line_segments_groups = []
209
210        for contour in contours_blurred:
211            # Approximate the contour with polygons (line segments)
212            epsilon = smoothness * cv2.arcLength(contour, True)  # Smoothness controls approximation
213            approx = cv2.approxPolyDP(contour, epsilon, True)
214
215            # Collect line segments for the current contour
216            line_segments = []
217            for i in range(len(approx)):
218                pt1 = (approx[i][0][0], approx[i][0][1])
219                pt2 = (approx[(i + 1) % len(approx)][0][0],
220                       approx[(i + 1) % len(approx)][0][1])  # Loop to connect last to first
221                line_segments.append([pt1, pt2])
222
223            # Add the current group of line segments to the result
224            line_segments_groups.append(line_segments)
225
226        self.line_segments_groups = line_segments_groups
227        return line_segments_groups


228


[docs]
229    def extract_points_groups(
230            self,
231            line_segments_groups: list[list[tuple[int, int]]] = None
232    ) -> list[list[tuple[int, int]]]:
233        """
234        Extract end points from list of edge segments
235
236        Args:
237            line_segments_groups (list[list[tuple[int, int]]], optional): List of line segments groups. (default: None)
238
239        Returns:
240            List of points groups, where each group corresponds to points in a contour
241        """
242        if line_segments_groups is None:
243            line_segments_groups = self.line_segments_groups
244
245        points = []
246
247        for line_segments in line_segments_groups:
248            group: list[tuple[int, int]] = []
249            for segment in line_segments:
250                group.append(segment[0])
251            group.append((group[0][0], group[0][1]))
252            points.append(group)
253
254        self.points_groups = points
255        return points


256


[docs]
257    def invert_point_groups(
258            self,
259            groups: list[list[tuple[Any, Any]]] = None,
260            rotation: int = 0
261    ) -> list[list[tuple[Any, Any]]]:
262        """
263        Invert points to make it view correctly
264
265        Args:
266            groups (list[list[tuple[Any, Any]]], optional): List of points groups. (default: None)
267            rotation (:obj:`int`, optional): Number of 90 degree clockwise rotations. (default: 0)
268
269        Returns:
270            List of points groups, where each group corresponds to points in a contour after inverting
271        """
272        if groups is None:
273            groups = self.points_groups
274
275        result = []
276        for group in groups:
277            temp_group = []
278            for point in group:
279                temp_point = [point[0], -point[1]]
280                for _ in range(rotation):
281                    temp_point[0], temp_point[1] = -temp_point[1], temp_point[0]
282                temp_group.append((temp_point[0], temp_point[1]))
283            result.append(temp_group)
284
285        self.points_groups = result
286        return result


287


[docs]
288    def resize_point_groups(
289            self,
290            groups: list[list[tuple[Any, Any]]] = None,
291            keep_aspect_ratio: bool = True,
292            border: Union[float, tuple[float, float]] = 5
293    ) -> list[list[tuple[float, float]]]:
294        """
295        Resize points to make it view correctly
296
297        Args:
298            groups (list[list[tuple[Any, Any]]], optional): List of points groups. (default: None)
299            keep_aspect_ratio (:obj:`bool`, optional): Whether to keep aspect ratio. (default: True)
300            border (:obj:`Union[float, tuple[float, float]]`, optional): Border size. (default: 5)
301
302        Returns:
303            List of points groups, where each group corresponds to points in a contour after resizing
304        """
305        if type(border) is not tuple:
306            border = (border, border)
307
308        temp_min_x = float('inf')
309        temp_min_y = float('inf')
310        temp_max_x = float('-inf')
311        temp_max_y = float('-inf')
312
313        if groups is None:
314            # TODO: Remove repeated line segments
315            groups = self.points_groups
316
317        for points in groups:
318            for point in points:
319                temp_min_x = min(temp_min_x, point[0])
320                temp_min_y = min(temp_min_y, point[1])
321                temp_max_x = max(temp_max_x, point[0])
322                temp_max_y = max(temp_max_y, point[1])
323
324        x_bound = self.max_x - self.min_x - 2 * border[0]
325        y_bound = self.max_y - self.min_y - 2 * border[1]
326
327        x_range = temp_max_x - temp_min_x
328        y_range = temp_max_y - temp_min_y
329
330        if keep_aspect_ratio:
331            x_ratio = y_ratio = min(x_bound / x_range, y_bound / y_range)
332            x_offset = (x_bound - x_range * x_ratio) / 2 + border[0]
333            y_offset = (y_bound - y_range * y_ratio) / 2 + border[1]
334        else:
335            x_ratio, y_ratio = x_bound / x_range, y_bound / y_range
336            x_offset, y_offset = border
337
338        resize_points = []
339        for group in groups:
340            tmp_group = []
341            for point in group:
342                x = (point[0] - temp_min_x) * x_ratio + self.min_x + x_offset
343                y = (point[1] - temp_min_y) * y_ratio + self.min_y + y_offset
344                tmp_group.append((x, y))
345            resize_points.append(tmp_group)
346
347        self.points_groups = resize_points
348        return resize_points


349


[docs]
350    def wait_idle(
351            self,
352            interval: float = 0.5
353    ) -> None:
354        """
355        Wait until robotic arm in Idle state
356
357        Note:
358            During the robotic arm homing process, the robotic arm will remain temporarily idle, which might cause it to exit the loop.
359
360        Args:
361            interval (:obj:`float`, optional): Time in seconds to wait between idle states. (default: 0.5)
362
363        Returns:
364            None
365        """
366        while self.robot.getState() != "Idle":
367            time.sleep(interval)


368


[docs]
369    def cali_z(
370            self,
371            homing: bool = True
372    ) -> float:
373        """
374        Manually set the z position for drawing
375
376        Args:
377            homing (:obj:`bool`, optional): Whether homing the robotic arm or not. (default: True)
378
379        Returns:
380            Z position
381        """
382        if homing:
383            self.robot.homing()
384        # TODO: Include wait_idle function in the library
385        self.wait_idle(interval=0.5)
386        # TODO: Rewrite getcoordinate if possible
387        # TODO: getcoordinate return string instead of number
388        temp_z = float(self.robot.getcoordinate(3))
389        # TODO: Rewrite writecoordinate function with optional input
390        self.robot.sendMsg(f"M20 G90 G00 X{self.min_x} Y{self.min_y} Z{temp_z}")
391        while (line := input("Moving down step size (\'Q\' for quit): ").lower()) != "q":
392            try:
393                line = -float(line)
394            except ValueError:
395                line = 0
396            temp_z += line
397            print(line)
398            self.robot.sendMsg(f"M20 G91 G00 Z{line}")
399            self.wait_idle()
400        self.z = temp_z
401        return self.z

[docs]
403    def draw_area(
404            self,
405            z_offset: float = 10
406    ) -> None:
407        """
408        Draw the boundary of drawing area
409
410        Args:
411            z_offset (:obj:`float`, optional): Z offset when draw the area. (default: 10)
412
413        Returns:
414            None
415        """
416        self.robot.sendMsg(f'M20 G90 G00 X{self.min_x} Y{self.min_y} Z{self.z + z_offset}')
417        self.robot.sendMsg(f'M20 G90 G00 X{self.max_x} Y{self.min_y} Z{self.z + z_offset}')
418        self.robot.sendMsg(f'M20 G90 G00 X{self.max_x} Y{self.max_y} Z{self.z + z_offset}')
419        self.robot.sendMsg(f'M20 G90 G00 X{self.min_x} Y{self.max_y} Z{self.z + z_offset}')
420        self.robot.sendMsg(f'M20 G90 G00 X{self.min_x} Y{self.min_y} Z{self.z + z_offset}')

[docs]
422    def preview(self) -> None:
423        """
424        Preview drawing trajectory
425
426        Returns:
427            None
428        """
429        plt.figure(figsize=(10, 10))
430
431        for group in self.points_groups:
432            for i in range(len(group)):
433                pt1 = group[i]
434                pt2 = group[(i + 1) % len(group)]
435                plt.plot([pt1[0], pt2[0]], [pt1[1], pt2[1]], color='blue')
436
437        plt.title(f"Approximated Line Segments")
438        plt.xlabel("X Coordinate")
439        plt.ylabel("Y Coordinate")
440        plt.xlim(self.min_x, self.max_x)
441        plt.ylim(self.min_y, self.max_y)
442        plt.axhline(0, color='black', linewidth=0.5, linestyle='--')
443        plt.axvline(0, color='black', linewidth=0.5, linestyle='--')
444        plt.grid(True)
445        plt.gca().set_aspect('equal', adjustable='box')
446        plt.show()

[docs]
449    def draw(
450            self,
451            image_path: str,
452            smoothness: float = 0.0001,
453            binary_threshold: int = 127,
454            method: int = cv2.RETR_TREE,
455            blur: bool = True,
456            edge_detection_threshold1: int = 100,
457            edge_detection_threshold2: int = 200,
458            rotation: int = 0,
459            keep_aspect_ratio: bool = True,
460            border: Union[float, tuple[float, float]] = 5,
461    ) -> None:
462        """
463        Draw the edges of given image
464
465        Args:
466            image_path (:obj:`str`): Input image path.
467            smoothness (:obj:`float`, optional): Smoothness parameter. Higher values simplify edges. (default: 0.0001)
468            binary_threshold (:obj:`int`, optional): Binary threshold for edge detection. (default: 127)
469            method (:obj:`int`, optional): Contour retrieval method. Options:
470                    cv2.RETR_TREE (default): Retrieve both inner and outer edges.
471                    cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL: Retrieve only the outer edges.
472            blur (:obj:`bool`, optional): Whether to apply Gaussian blur before edge detection. (default: True)
473            edge_detection_threshold1 (:obj:`int`, optional): Lower threshold for Canny edge detection. (default: 100)
474            edge_detection_threshold2 (:obj:`int`, optional): Upper threshold for Canny edge detection. (default: 200)
475            rotation (:obj:`int`, optional): Number of 90 degree clockwise rotations. (default: 0)
476            keep_aspect_ratio (:obj:`bool`, optional): Whether to keep aspect ratio. (default: True)
477            border (:obj:`Union[float, tuple[float, float]]`, optional): Border size. (default: 5)
478
479        Returns:
480            None
481        """
482        self.edges_from_image(
483            image_path,
484            smoothness=smoothness,
485            binary_threshold=binary_threshold,
486            method=method, blur=blur,
487            edge_detection_threshold1=edge_detection_threshold1,
488            edge_detection_threshold2=edge_detection_threshold2
489        )
490
491        self.extract_points_groups()
492        self.invert_point_groups(rotation=rotation)
493        self.resize_point_groups(keep_aspect_ratio=keep_aspect_ratio, border=border)
494
495        if not self.pre_drawing():
496            return
497
498        for resized_points in self.points_groups:
499            self.draw_points(resized_points)


500
501


[docs]
502    def draw_points(
503            self,
504            points: list[tuple[float, float]],
505            z_offset: float = 10
506    ) -> None:
507        """
508        Draw given group of points
509
510        Args:
511            points (:obj:`list[tuple[float, float]]`): list of points coordinates
512            z_offset (:obj:`float`, optional): Z offset when moving between line segments. (default: 10)
513
514        Returns:
515            None
516        """
517        if len(points) == 0:
518            return
519
520        try:
521            first_point = points[0]
522            last_point = points[-1]
523
524            self.robot.sendMsg(f'M20 G90 G00 X{first_point[0]:2f} Y{first_point[1]:2f} Z{self.z + z_offset:2f}')
525
526            for point in points:
527                self.robot.sendMsg(f'M20 G90 G00 X{point[0]:2f} Y{point[1]:2f} Z{self.z:2f}')
528
529            self.robot.sendMsg(f'M20 G90 G00 X{last_point[0]:2f} Y{last_point[1]:2f} Z{self.z + z_offset:2f}')
530        except KeyboardInterrupt:
531            # TODO: Emergency stop
532            pass


533


[docs]
534    @classmethod
535    def mid_points(
536            cls,
537            points: list[tuple[float, float]]
538    ) -> list[tuple[float, float]]:
539        """
540        Find mid-points of given group of points
541
542        Args:
543            points (:obj:`list[tuple[float, float]]`): list of points coordinates
544
545        Returns:
546            List of mid-points coordinates
547        """
548        if len(points) == 0:
549            return []
550
551        tmp = []
552        for i in range(len(points) - 1):
553            pt_x, pt_y = points[i][0] + points[i + 1][0], points[i][1] + points[i + 1][1]
554            tmp.append((pt_x / 2, pt_y / 2))
555
556        if points[0] == points[-1]:
557            tmp.append((tmp[0][0], tmp[0][1]))
558
559        return tmp


560


[docs]
561    @classmethod
562    def generate_polygon_vertices(
563            cls,
564            num_side: int
565    ) -> list[tuple[float, float]]:
566        """
567        Generate the list of polygon vertices of given number of sides
568
569        Args:
570            num_side (:obj:`int`): Number of sides
571
572        Returns:
573            List of polygon vertices closed loop (points[0] == points[-1])
574        """
575        angle = 2 * math.pi / num_side
576        tmp = []
577        for i in range(num_side):
578            tmp.append((math.cos(i * angle), math.sin(i * angle)))
579        tmp.append((tmp[0][0], tmp[0][1]))
580        return tmp


581


[docs]
582    def pre_drawing(self) -> bool:
583        """
584        Drawing preparation
585
586        Returns:
587            True if preparation pass; False otherwise
588        """
589        self.preview()
590        while (line := input('Sample plot looks good? (y/[n]): ')).lower() != 'y':
591            if line == '' or line.lower() == 'n':
592                # TODO: smoothness
593                return False
594        self.draw_area()
595        if input('Start drawing? (y/[n]): ').lower() != 'y':
596            return False
597        return True


598


[docs]
599    def draw_poly(
600            self,
601            num_side: int,
602            depth: int
603    ) -> None:
604        """
605        Draw a polygon with a specified number of sides and iteratively refines it for a given depth.
606
607        Args:
608            num_side (:obj:`int`): Number of sides for the base polygon.
609            depth (:obj:`int`): Number of iterations to refine and draw the polygon.
610
611        Returns:
612            None
613        """
614        points = Drawing.generate_polygon_vertices(num_side)
615        self.points_groups = [points]
616        points = self.resize_point_groups(keep_aspect_ratio=True)[0]
617
618        if not self.pre_drawing():
619            return
620
621        for _ in range(depth):
622            self.points_groups = [points]
623            self.draw_points(points)
624            points = Drawing.mid_points(points)
625            self.wait_idle()




626
627
628if __name__ == "__main__":
629    drawer = Drawing()
630    drawer.cali_z()
631
632    # Sample of drawing spiral
633    drawer.draw('sample/spiral.jpg')
634
635    # Sample of drawing polygon
636    drawer.draw_poly(num_side=5, depth=3)
